Driver:  200705230230 + fix for 176227

Generating and running of the generated JUnit (HTTP, SOAP11 and SOAP12) with Axis2 bottom-up plus client scenario is fine.  However, when I do a skeleton with client + JUnit, the generation is fine but the running of the JUnit resulted in the error:

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:53)
	at webservice.echo.EchoServiceTest$tempCallbackN1000C.receiveErrorhello(EchoServiceTest.java:65)
	at webservice.echo.EchoServiceStub$3.onError(EchoServiceStub.java:279)
	at org.apache.axis2.description.OutInAxisOperationClient$NonBlockingInvocationWorker.run(OutInAxisOperation.java:422)
	at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:665)
	at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:690)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)
Unless this is an easy fix that could come in very soon.  This would have to be deferred to WTP 2.0.1.

The problem is probably more related to the WSDL being used rather than skeleton plus client scenario.  If I use Converter.wsdl (generated by Axis2 in a bottom-up scenario), the HTTP and SOAP12 JUnits ran successfully but SOAP11 JUnit ran with the following error:

Exception in thread "Axis2 Task" junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:53)
	at wtp.ConverterConverterSOAP11Port_httpTest$tempCallbackN1000C.receiveErrorcelsiusToFarenheit(ConverterConverterSOAP11Port_httpTest.java:65)
	at wtp.ConverterConverterSOAP11Port_httpStub$1.onError(ConverterConverterSOAP11Port_httpStub.java:290)

When I ran with Echo.wsdl and AreaService.wsdl (generated using Axis1), the error occurs.  I'll attach the WSDLs being used.

Do you know the cause of the generated JUnit failing to run and the workaround, if any?  The JUnits are a great way to test.  Too bad it only works with a very selected few WSDL files and failed with a lot of the WSDL files that you listed in the test plan.  For example, http://www.webservicex.net/CurrencyConvertor.asmx?wsdl and  http://webservices.daelab.net/temperatureconversions/TemperatureConversions.wso?WSDL

Hi Lahiru,

I am also testing with Converter.wsdl and run into this problem.  In my case, all of HTTP, SOAP11, SOAP12 tests fail with the same message that Kathy posted.  What's different is that I always get 2/4 test fail due to timeout (whereas Kathy's tests fail right away).  The tests are:

    testcelsiusToFarenheit       <-- timeout
    testStartcelsiusToFarenheit
    testfarenheitToCelsius       <-- timeout
    testStartfarenheitToCelsius

The errors mentioned goes away after filling in the proper client code to invoke the stub with valid values.  I've tested the AreaService and Converter WSDLs and they are all fine.

Hi Kathy, 

since you have reported issue is working for you with the proposals, which I made that we need to  filling in the proper client code to
invoke the stub with valid values, can we resolve this issue. 
I have verified this. 
Andrew do you still facing problems. 

thanks 

Lahiru

After adding the implementation to the SOAP11 test stub, the test case can run now.  However, when I do the same thing with the HTTP test stub, I still get the same error.

I think the problem here is closely related to the issue in bug 193996.  There are a number of points to consider:

- first, the service to test against needs to have the correct port up and running (bug 193996 is preventing this).
- similarly, on the client generation side, we need to specify the matching port.

Given the above, I think it make sense that the HTTP tests stub is not working in my case, because only the SOAP11 port is up and running on my service.  And perhaps the HTTP/SOAP test stubs should not have been generated at all to avoid confusion.
